review: The first time I set it up I had a little issue from my Chromebook and Note 3. So I did it from my laptop and now when I move it in between tvs it is a breeze. I had a Android stick which was like a tablet but I really did not like how we had to use the screen on my phone to move the mouse arrow. The chromecast does less but does exactly what I need. I stream from my chrome browser, netflix , Youtube, Google Play Music and thats pretty much all I need. Worth every penny. No need for Roku any more. I will probably buy three more.
author: Bigchrome

review: Great little device. I was watching YouTube and Netflix on my Wii. Dragging speakers around the house to listen to Pandora. Now I've plugged this thing in, it has integrated my media apps with the TV. $35 and done. Often when friends and I watch movies, it starts conversations about things on YouTube like (HISHE) and we can quickly jump to YouTube (in HD) on the TV.I did have some signal issues with the wifi (goes through several walls at angles and the TV blocks), but I used the 3"  extension cord they provide and I'm set.
author: Nik

review: I love this thing.  How much better than "plug it in and use it" can you get?  And the price is definitely right compared to other products.  We have primarily used it for Netflix so far.  Smooth and responsive.  It also allows you to push your Chrome browser onto your device.  I have used that to watch Funny Or Die on my TV when I was too lazy to go to the computer!  That is a little jumpy, but I think its still in beta.  I wish there were more services/apps that were Chromecast-compatible, but I think that's just a matter of time.  If Chromecast was forever limited to what it has not I would be a little disappointed...but only a little.
author: Rancheros

review: It does work well if you have the latest software.  Don't try to use it with old versions.  Works great from iphone 5.
